abstract.t: The Web Real Time Communications (WebRTC) family of protocols defines mechanism for direct interactive rich communication using audio, video, and data between two peers' web browsers. With in the WebRTC framework, the Session Description Protocol (SDP) is used for negotiating session capabilities between the peers. Such a negotiation happens based on the SDP offer/answer exchange mechanism
This document provides an informational reference in describing the role of SDP and the offer/answer exchange mechanism for the most common WebRTC use cases.
This document makes no changes to the SDP offer/answer exchange mechanism.
